c199587fec60370a7b74a190986f7b6f (02:12): hi all, how do i make one div constrain the size of the div inside it?
c199587fec60370a7b74a190986f7b6f (02:12): i thought it had something to do with setting position: relative
b896c09b0788e305fdc746085853a996 (02:13): as long as you don't apply a specific  size to the div inside,
b896c09b0788e305fdc746085853a996 (02:13): doesn't this happen by default?
b896c09b0788e305fdc746085853a996 (02:13): Except in ie6 of course
c199587fec60370a7b74a190986f7b6f (02:13): hmm it seems like the text in my inner div is expanding beyond the outer div, in firefox.
c199587fec60370a7b74a190986f7b6f (02:14): maybe i have some other settings interfering
b896c09b0788e305fdc746085853a996 (02:14): that has to do with how you set overflow
b896c09b0788e305fdc746085853a996 (02:14): the overflow property
b896c09b0788e305fdc746085853a996 (02:14): It can become a scrollbar box,
b896c09b0788e305fdc746085853a996 (02:14): or just cut the text off
b896c09b0788e305fdc746085853a996 (02:15): except in IE which simply does everything wrong for some reason, in regard to that property
c199587fec60370a7b74a190986f7b6f (02:15): hmm, so if i want it to wrap properly, i shoudl just set width?
c199587fec60370a7b74a190986f7b6f (02:15): cuz that woks
b896c09b0788e305fdc746085853a996 (02:16): it's expanding horizontally
b896c09b0788e305fdc746085853a996 (02:16): I assumed vertically. I have made an ass out of u and me
c199587fec60370a7b74a190986f7b6f (02:17): yes it is, bretonsli
c199587fec60370a7b74a190986f7b6f (02:17): horizontally the text goes outside the width of the container div
c199587fec60370a7b74a190986f7b6f (02:17): i'll just set the width then of the div containing the text
c199587fec60370a7b74a190986f7b6f (02:17): works nicely
4e651b38c860db531b6427c3076affca (02:18): if it works, go with it

5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:32): hi all, i understand that if i have element A floated to the left and element B with normal flow and a background color, the background of element B will show up behind element A (in FF, at least)
5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:33): is there some way to turn that off so the background of B does not flow behind A?
5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:33): without changing margins?
5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:33): i dont want to set a margin of B
6ca7ec0c4de701b98f9eb33014282f14 (02:34): is there anotherway than min-height to make a div atleast as high as the client-window, like height:100%?
5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:34): Hub441: there's not a great cross-platform way, i dont believe
5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:34): Hub441: but you do need to set the height and the body of the page to both 100%
5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:35): er, i said that wrong
5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:35): you want: html, body { height: 100%; }
5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:36): and then, everything immediate children of your body tag can have their height set to 100%....
5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:37): yikes my english is leaving much to be desired today
5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:38): anybody know the answer to my question?
6ca7ec0c4de701b98f9eb33014282f14 (02:38): spiderworm: yeah, looks fine thx
5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:39): Hub441: do you perchance know the answer to my question? will repost for you....

5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:39): [14:29] <spiderworm> hi all, i understand that if i have element A floated to the left and element B with normal flow and a background color, the background of element B will show up behind element A (in FF, at least)
5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:40): [14:30] <spiderworm> is there some way to turn that off so the background of B does not flow behind A?
bc075c41a4d2dbb1abbdf399c9738994 (02:45): spiderworm: you could set a left margin for B. It doesn't allow the content to wrap underneath the floated content though.
bc075c41a4d2dbb1abbdf399c9738994 (02:45): what do you want for the background in A?
6ca7ec0c4de701b98f9eb33014282f14 (02:45): spiderworm: same thing in konqueror. setting a background for A may be a work around
5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:45): berko: i know that i can do that, the problem is, the floated element A is dynamic and the user can press a button to make it appear / disappear
bc075c41a4d2dbb1abbdf399c9738994 (02:46): sounds like setting the background for A is the best option
5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:46): berko: the background for floated element A is just plain white, for B it is an non-repeated image background
bc075c41a4d2dbb1abbdf399c9738994 (02:47): spiderworm: and B's bg still shows up behind A?

5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:47): berko: if i set the background of A then i have to make the background of B extend the width of A and B.... and i dont know how well IE will handle that since it does not display the background of B correctly
6ca7ec0c4de701b98f9eb33014282f14 (02:48): spiderworm: even with <A style="background-color:white;" >... ?
5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:48): berko: well, not when I specify the background color
5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:48): berko: i guess more correctly, element A has no background, but it appears white
5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (02:48): one sec, gotta gio
bc075c41a4d2dbb1abbdf399c9738994 (02:49): and A & B are sibling elements?
4e651b38c860db531b6427c3076affca (02:55): okay here's a question. When I float an a large element,
4e651b38c860db531b6427c3076affca (02:55): it vertically collapses the div which contains it
4e651b38c860db531b6427c3076affca (02:55): since it's taken out of the "normal flow"
4e651b38c860db531b6427c3076affca (02:55): is there any way to prevent this
4e651b38c860db531b6427c3076affca (02:56): so that the containing div maintains a height large enough to contain the floated div?
bbeb9fa90cdc7ad15af60431a07a549d (02:56): `float
4e651b38c860db531b6427c3076affca (02:57): oh... float the containing div?
bbeb9fa90cdc7ad15af60431a07a549d (02:57): no
bbeb9fa90cdc7ad15af60431a07a549d (02:57): hold on
bbeb9fa90cdc7ad15af60431a07a549d (02:58): http://complexspiral.com/publications/containing-floats/
bc075c41a4d2dbb1abbdf399c9738994 (02:58): ah, I see what the deal is. breton, I tend to add a br.clearer after the floated element
bc075c41a4d2dbb1abbdf399c9738994 (02:59): .clearer{line-height:1px; clear:both;}
bc075c41a4d2dbb1abbdf399c9738994 (03:00): actually, after the unfloated element.
4e651b38c860db531b6427c3076affca (03:00): hrmn that doesn't seem like it would work, but you say it does?
4e651b38c860db531b6427c3076affca (03:01): floats confuse the hell out of me
bbeb9fa90cdc7ad15af60431a07a549d (03:01): read the link i posted
4e651b38c860db531b6427c3076affca (03:02): reading
5a87288a7a24364fe6d296736e8ff9d8 (03:24): berko: to answer your questions, yes, element A and B are siblings
